item.title: Prairie Pockets
item.description: Love this from @DukeGardens. Let's turn more medians into pocket prairies full of native plants! üòçüåæüåª https://t.co/vopsfWT5Ix — NC Botanical Garden (@NCBotGarden) December 16, 2020 Following the success of Sarah P. Duke Gardens‚Äô Piedmont Prairie in the Blomquist Garden, the horticulture staff is experimenting with ‚Äúprairie pockets‚Äù in parking lot medians. The results look great so far!

item.title: Get involved
item.description: Community Science Projects North Carolina Piedmont Roadside Native Plants Southern Piedmont Pine-Oak Savannas Restoration Projects and Guides McDowell Nature Center and Preserve: “The piedmont prairie restoration area of the preserve provides habitat for a federally endangered plant: Schweinitz’s sunflower, a federal candidate species: Georgia aster, and one rare plant: prairie dock.” How to restore a native grass meadow: Horton Grove Nature Preserve Success Story

item.title: Natural History
item.description: Historical evidence suggests American Bison ranged widely across the Southeast during at least the 16th and 17th centuries (Rostlund 1960). To have been successful, bison would have needed large tracts of open, grassy areas. Despite the myth that a squirrel could cross the Piedmont from mountains to the coastal plain across a sea of trees and academic literature that refers to the pre-colonial Piedmont region as ‚ÄúSouthern Forest‚Äù (e.
